definition: place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: So as I face tomorrow with its problems large and small.
sentences.chinese: 故我面臨的遭遇，不論大小的難處。

sentences.english: Now as you might guess, This can make gas hydrate kind of hard for miners to handle.
sentences.chinese: 你應該已經猜想到這會使礦工們很難處理它們。

sentences.english: The excreta of humans and land animals contain soluble refractory organic matter.
sentences.chinese: 人和陸生動物排泄物含有可溶的難處理有機物質。

sentences.english: Restaurant and kitchen swill (RKS) is a sort of organic garbage in city, which is not easy to be disposed.
sentences.chinese: 餐廚垃圾屬於一類較難處置的城市有機垃圾。

sentences.english: Their difficult relationship has lasted for a decade and a half.
sentences.chinese: 不過，他們關係難處，僅只維持了十年半。

sentences.english: Zhuang Guiyang discusses the difficulty of analysing climate-change policy-making in China.
sentences.chinese: 莊貴陽在文章內討論了中國在氣候決策方面的難處。

sentences.english: God hath seen mine affliction and the labour of my hands, and rebuked thee yesternight .
sentences.chinese: 但上帝看見我的難處和勞苦，於是就在昨夜責備你。

sentences.english: The gold ore from Zimudang Mine is typical refractory gold ore in south-west area of Guizhou Province.
sentences.chinese: 紫木凼金礦石是黔西南地區較典型的難處理金礦石。

sentences.english: Arsenical gld ore is one kind of the most refractory ores.
sentences.chinese: 砷金礦石屬於難處理金礦石之一。

sentences.english: FEW weeks ago my colleague wrote about the difficulties of translating Pushkin.
sentences.chinese: 幾星期前，我同事寫了寫關於翻譯普希金的難處。

sentences.english: We sometimes experience difficulties and seem at the end of our tethers , as if all is hopeless.
sentences.chinese: 有時候我們經歷難處，看來毫無出路，好像要絕望了。

sentences.english: A FEW weeks ago my colleague wrote about the difficulties of translating Pushkin.
sentences.chinese: 幾星期前，我同事寫了寫關於翻譯普希金的難處。

sentences.english: The damage begins from the dermis which make them very hard to deal with.
sentences.chinese: 損害開始從真皮這使他們很難處理。

sentences.english: You have to respond the way Jesus would.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你必須像耶穌一般的迴應難處。

sentences.english: It could proceed the filter of some slurry which is difficult to be dehydrated.
sentences.chinese: 可進行難處理的過濾性原液過濾。

sentences.english: It is difficult to treat coke-making wastewater with high toxicity and organism.
sentences.chinese: 焦化廢水毒性大，有機物含量高，較難處理。

definition: willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
